definition: (of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]

sentences.english: Well, I was perfectly honest and square with her;
sentences.chinese: 不過，我對她可是襟懷坦白，光明正大。

sentences.english: His business dealings are above board.
sentences.chinese: 他的生意往來是光明正大的。

sentences.english: The transaction was totally aboveboard, so there was no reason to question it.
sentences.chinese: 這筆交易完全是光明正大的，因此沒有理由去質疑它。

sentences.english: Eg. The deal was completely above board.
sentences.chinese: 這筆交易是完全光明正大的。

sentences.english: Tom is dicussing anything under the sun with Jim.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆和吉姆正在光明正大的聊天。

sentences.english: The deal was completely above board.
sentences.chinese: 這筆交易完全是光明正大的。

sentences.english: Although not openly, but also the hardships of love, but another child is a different feeling.
sentences.chinese: 雖不能光明正大，也愛的苦，但是另有一番滋味兒。

sentences.english: My business dealings are above board.
sentences.chinese: 我做生意都是光明正大的。
